entry.title: Mission: Accidental Marriage
entry.summary:
Author: DarkInsanity (Stereklenidus)

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,852Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: It was supposed to be a simple, undercover mission: pose as a married couple to stop a witch at a resort. For Stiles and Derek, it was just another day in Beacon Hills. The problem? The pack finds out. And in Beacon Hills, a fake marriage is just a few missed calls and a viral meme away from becoming pack-wide fact. Now, with Lydia planning the reception, Scott looking up venues, and Peter smugly hinting at "supernatural bonding clauses," Stiles is in a panic to set the record straight. Derek, however, seems infuriatingly unbothered by the whole thing. As the charade spirals out of control, Stiles is forced to confront the terrifying possibility that the one thing he's pretending to be might be the one thing he actually wants to be.

entry.title: The missing bite
entry.summary:
Author: Helloloveyes

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,334Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 93

Summary: His hand went to the side of his neck more often than not. At first, Derek thought it was merely a nervous tic, those long fingers reaching to the tender skin. But then he realized those fingers weren't just twitching; they were searching.-.-Derek didn't want to know. There was an eerie, growing hypothesis forming about why Stiles kept touching that spot, why he had been so devastated at first, and why he sometimes seemed to get lost inside his head, a wandering hand patting the empty space next to him.-.-The wolf started to hate how Stiles’s hand would occasionally drift to his left shoulder, searching, hoping for the mating bite that should have been there. He felt the primal, clawing need to bite there himself, to sink his fangs into that tender flesh and give Stiles the mark he yearned for.

entry.title: 'cause being your punchline still is something
entry.summary:
Author: whiry

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,963Chapters: 1/21Kudos: 19

Summary: Born into a world of the supernatural and forced to segregate himself and his human peers from the supernatural creatures that inhabit Beacon Hills, Stiles grew up with the belief that integration was the key to a better life, thanks to his mother’s social work. Of course, that belief is only furthered by the mate mark he bears of his mate’s first words to him, something only supernatural creatures and their occasional human mates are supposed to have. Desperate to find his mate and carry on his mother’s work after her death, Stiles does everything in his power to unite his town, even if that means enduring dinners with Derek Hale, who hates him and refuses to speak to him. After a terse interaction, Derek finally speaks and the two realize they’re mates. Well, surely Stiles can still get his happy ending. Right?

entry.title: i’ve got the gift of one liners
entry.summary:
Author: LyraRaineSparrow

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,112Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 5

Summary: Scott meets her first. Deaton introduces her as Ashley, the new vet assistant. She‘s good with the animals. But something’s off about her. All Scott knows is that she kinda creeps him out sometimes.Stiles meets her second. Ash sticks out like a sore thumb in Beacon Hills. She looks like a walking advertisement for Hot Topic. The gentle smile and southern accent are the last things he expects. He thinks maybe Scott‘s just never met an emo kid before.The sheriff meets her third. He gets a call a few days before Christmas about a strange truck that keeps parking overnight behind an apartment complex with a teenaged girl sleeping in the cab. She gives some excuse about getting in a fight with her parents and looking for a place to hide out for a few days. His gut tells him there‘s more to her story, but he chooses to believe her in the moment. A few days later, he comes across Ashley‘s truck again.Turns out, Ashley Lenore is an emancipated minor who travelled cross-country to get as far away from her parents as possible. And that‘s how Noah ends up as the parent/guardian of two hyperactive teenagers.OR: A shameless self-insert where I fix canon my own way and try to make writing fun again.
